text: The Chacra Face Road is one of eight Ancestral Puebloan roads that enters Chaco Canyon, New Mexico. It enters the canyon through a break in the Chacra Mesa called the Fajada Gap, and ends at the great house Una Vida. It probably connected Una Vida to an eastern Puebloan community, Guadalupe Outlier. ==References== ;Bibliography * Category:Archaeological sites in New Mexico Category:Chaco Canyon Category:Chaco Culture National Historical Park Category:Colorado Plateau Category:Ancestral Puebloans Category:Post-Archaic period in North America Category:Native American history of New Mexico
title: Chacra Face Road
